data.title: Mississippi Valley names North Alabama's Karl Morgan as head football coach
data.meta_description: TTA BENA, Miss. -- North Alabama defensive coordinator Karl Morgan has been named Mississippi Valley State head football coach. The former UCLA standout and Alcorn State defensive coordinator takes over the program from Willie Totten, who stepped down Nov. 30 after 8 seasons.
data.text:
ITTA BENA, Miss. -- North Alabama defensive coordinator Karl Morgan has been named Mississippi Valley State head football coach. The former UCLA standout and Alcorn State defensive coordinator takes over the program from Willie Totten, who stepped down Nov. 30 after 8 seasons.

The Delta Devils finished 3-8 in 2009, and Totten was 31-57 during his tenure.

Morgan, who played in the NFL as a defensive tackle with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, spent the previous five seasons as UNA's defensive coordinator. The Lions were 55-10 during his tenure, including a Gulf South Conference championship and five NCAA Division II playoff berths.

Morgan has 21 years of coaching experience, including stints as defensive line coach at Nicholls State, Southern University, Purdue and Arkansas State. He served as defensive coordinator at Alcorn in 2001 and at Hampton from 2002-04.

At North Alabama, Morgan worked with head coach Terry Bowden.
